result.execSummary:
The defendant Reannajean S B Waubanascum-Matchopatow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Reannajean S B Waubanascum-Matchopatow in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Citizenship and firearms info provided.  Joint recommendation to fine & costs only.  Court orders $868.00 fine, costs and DNA surcharge.

Defendant Reannajean S B Waubanascum-Matchopatow in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Court quashes warrant ordered 4/6 but was not to be signed until after today if defendant failed to appear.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Rodman Wells Streicher in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will not issue a warrant at this time.  Clerk ot send out notice for next week.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
